goal.ch: 配合教育部「大專院校動物替代技術人才培育計畫」中心學校 (國立中興大學) 開課要求，在大多數生物醫學研究中，研究人員通常會依賴實驗動物來進行研究。然而，當前正有不少研究在尋找不依賴實驗動物的替代方案。在台灣和國際上，基於 3R 原則：替代（Replacement）、減量（Reduction）和精緻化（Refinement），相關的替代方法不斷被開發和更新。雖然這些替代方法有其優勢，但也面臨著一定的限制和挑戰。本課程旨在讓學生理解和討論以下問題：(1) 為何需要使用實驗動物及其替代的必要性？(2) 替代實驗動物的優勢和限制是什麼？(3) 如何選擇合適的替代方法？(4) 實施這些替代方案的難度。課程内容涵蓋四大主題：包括細胞和組織培養、建立動物模型的電腦模擬、利用增強現實（AR）進行教學訓練、相關儀器檢測技術建立（與國衛院醫奈所貴儀中心合作）。課程將探討 3R 原則的局限性及其追求的目標，最終讓學生理解 AR技術應用於解剖的優勢，以及開發動物替代方案可能需要的儀器設備，也了解如何在技術開發中導入法人研發能量。
goal.en: In accordance with “MOE Talent Cultivation Project for Alternative Animal Techniques in Tertiary Education,“ courses are being offered by central institutions (NCHU). In most biomedical studies, researchers typically rely on experimental animals. However, a growing body of research is exploring alternatives that do not depend on the use of live animals. Globally, including in Taiwan, alternatives are being developed and updated based on the 3R principles of Replacement, Reduction, and Refinement. Although these alternatives offer several advantages, they face specific limitations and challenges. This course aims to enable students to understand and discuss the following issues: (1) Why is there a need for experimental animals and alternatives? (2) What are the advantages and limitations of substituting for experimental animals? (3) How can appropriate alternative methods be selected? (4) Difficulties involved in implementing these alternatives. The course covers four main topics: cell and tissue culture, computer simulations of animal models, augmented reality (AR) training, and the learning of related instrument testing techniques in collaboration with the Institute of Biomedical Engineering and Nanomedicine (I-BEN) service at the National Health Research Institutes. The course will explore the limitations and objectives of the 3R principles and ultimately help students understand the advantages of using AR technology in anatomical applications, the equipment needed to develop animal alternatives, and how to integrate the R＆D capabilities of NHRI into technological advancements.
